title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL (Bengaluru)
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application, after which I was invited to take the stata and case study tests, and then an interview with the Principal Investigators. It takes about a month for the entire process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join J-PAL?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Had one round of interviews with 3 panelists. Straight forward. There was a technical test prior to the interviews. The questions were easy to answer and it was a virtual interview.
Interview Questions: How will you describe randomized control trials to someone?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: There was a written test given, and an interview was scheduled afterward. The questions weren't terrible, and the panel was friendly. It was a good experience, and communication was easy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for J-PAL?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: For the statistical programming test they ask you whether you would like to do it in Stata or R and then you set a date and time for the exam. At that time, you receive an email with a zipped file containing the exam and dataset , and instructions. However, the time allowed to complete it vary across PIs, research team and seniority of tasks assigned to the role you applied to.
Interview Questions: Data manipulation/ data cleaning/ reasoning for all procedure/ interpretation of results/ econometric knowledge questions

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: General interview which focuses on strengths, weaknesses, work ethic, and past experiences and its relevance to the work. Relatively little time was spent on technical skills like data processing software and knowledge on economics.
Interview Questions: How would you ensure that your work meets a high standard?

title: Training Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions:
There are 3 Rounds.

1. Application test: 4 hour long test with written and technical assignments (based on RCTs and written communication)

2. 2 Interviews: Fit round, why J-PAL, why training team, etc.

Technical Round: RCTs, weaknesses, explain it in simple words, convince someone to use an RCT
Interview Questions: why J-PAL, why this team

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL (New Delhi) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Stage 1: CV shortlisting Stage 2: Stata test and Case Study Analysis (This includes questions that test your knowledge of experimental research, RCT, data analysis, and communication skills) Stage 3: Interview with the Research Manager (some technical questions and motivation for the application) Stage 4: Interview with one/more than one PIs (some technical questions and motivation for the application)
Interview Questions: -Tell me about yourself and your background. -Why do you want to join J-PAL and why the development sector in general? -How has your past work/academic experiences nurtured you for this role? -Some case study questions. -Some research design questions based on contexts. -Some basic stata codes for data merging, t-test, string to float, etc. -What are your medium and long term plans? -How would you deal with issues like personal data loss during field survey?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: They have 3-5 interviews that ask about your knowledge in RCTs and your economics research experience. They may ask about Instrumental variables and power calculations too. They test you in Stata or R and statistical results interpretation.
Interview Questions: They have 3-5 interviews that ask about your knowledge in RCTs and your economics research experience. They may ask about Instrumental variables and power calculations too. They test you in Stata or R and statistical results interpretation.

title: Policy Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: A written test is given where one needs to answer a number of technical questions. The interview follows, which involves a panel of staff. There were direct questions and friendly staff.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for the role?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Before I get Interviewed, there is a written test that is quite difficult if you don't have strong written and analytic skill,s especially using STATA. Better to prepare it before.
Interview Questions: What do you know about RCT?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: group interview and individual interview that can be difficult for some individuals to share info with a group of candidate. Individual interview includes common set of questions that can be asked at any employer
Interview Questions: N/A

title: (Senior) Research and Training Associate  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Began with a short data screening exercise. Followed by a 3.5 hr data/coding test. Followed by a 30 min interview with multiple staff. It was tedious but they were prompt in getting back to you.
Interview Questions: How would you solve this econometric problem?

title: Senior research and training associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Cambridge, MA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: First a data analysis screening which took 20 minutes (interpreting regression tables and a balance test), then a 3.5-hour data and policy exam. Finally an interview with two people who might have been robots. A pretty unenjoyable interview with some rigid technical questions and no smiles. Over a month later they emailed saying they were pursuing a different candidate
Interview Questions: Describe what you are estimating when performing a difference-in-differences

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Expect a very long and involved process. This will consume a significant amount of your time, regardless of whether you get an offer or not. There is very little transparency throughout the process, and if you don't ask to clarify what the next steps will be, you won't know.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about RCTs?
Why J-PAL?

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was done in two rounds, both were interactive rounds with the affiliates. They tested me on my knowledge about RCTs, power calculations and project management.  Each interview was 30-45 mins long
Interview Questions: Q. How do you manage a large field team? what are some challenges you have faced in the past and solutions you came up with?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: There were 4 rounds. Each interview was of one hour. It was a grt experience. The interviewers were quite nice and experienced people. Overall everything was good. It was great and the company is super cool.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join it??

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at J-PAL in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted shortly after submitting my application. I had a one-hour interview with someone from the J-PAL team and research partners and did not have to complete a Stata test.
Interview Questions: How will your previous experience translate to the job duties described for this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
the first round of the interview was to see if I fit the requirements of the job position  (behavioral interview)
the second round was in the form of a technical test (writing part + statistical coding part)
the third round was an interview with the supervisors and research directors
Interview Questions:
do you speak English 
do you master statistical programming languages

title: Policy Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I heard back in 4-6 weeks.  I interviewed with the hiring manager. Questions related to previous research + RCT's.  I was also asked to analyse a case. Very friendly and amazing HR team.
Interview Questions: Previous Policy experience, and  research experience

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The selection process consisted of a statistics based test, and a case study. The statistics test was fairly lengthy, asking candidates to perform operations on a dataset. They asked to use STATA for the exam, but welcomed the use of other language(s).
Interview Questions:
Data cleaning
Data operations
Regression analysis
Case Study

title: Research and Policy Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL (Jakarta) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: A short 30-minute interview with one administrative associate, one research associate, and one policy associate.  The interviewers were very accommodating and friendly. The questions particularly revolve around demonstrating the candidate's understanding in impact evaluation and past experience in data analysis.
Interview Questions: Describe your experiences with data analysis and impact evaluation

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviews, relatively easy, one STATA test and motivation questions; the overall process was not really hard, knowledge of local context very appreciated.

Working here is sometimes stressful but a lot a meaning brings motivation.
Interview Questions: Personal background, education, knowledge about research topic

title: Systems Snalyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, structured and  organized. Interviewer was very respectful and ensured environment was not stressful before proceeding. Highly recommened tbis compaby for their prpfessionalism. Interview was done online due to pandemic
Interview Questions: Behavior questions and past experiences

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: I had an online interview with two workers of the lab based in Europe. At the end, the HR person asked me some questions in French as the language knowledge was one of the desired requirement of the post.
Interview Questions: In addition to the usual interview questions, they asked my understanding of the randomized controlled trial methodology.

title: Policy and Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Some technical questions, mostly behavioral. They asked some questions about background and experience. Then about motivations and career goals. There were a few questions about interpreting data and econometric concepts.
Interview Questions: How does your academic focus relate to this internship?

title: Field Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: interviewer was polite, and the interview process went well and good ,nice job  if you live near office. if questions are just about our knowledge about the company.interviewer was polite, and the interview process went well and good ,nice job  if you live near office. if questions are just about our knowledge about the company.
Interview Questions:
where you live?
what is your qualification?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Terrible. Rude interviewer with wrong information about topics. Interviewer was also judgemental, kept interrupting, and asked personal questions. Also told me to consider switching my career path. Happy to say I now have a job in the same career path and didn't need to switch. Terrible individual, unsurprising that the position has been vacant for 8 months.
Interview Questions: Asked why don't you consider being a journalist instead?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL (Mumbai) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews - one with the manager and the other with the PIs. The one with the manager is detailed whereas the one with the PIs - they want to know more about why do you want to do this job, etc.
Interview Questions: How is piloting different from the main survey?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Very very extensive interview process. Be willing to spend up to 3-4 months waiting for a hiring confirmation. Org is also quite hierarchical which reflects in the interview process as you proceed upwards. Overall they focus on excellence but slightly too picky.
Interview Questions: Depends on the role being hired for

title: Training Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL (Jakarta)
Interview Descriptions:
8 hours of written test consisting of 4 questions about policy brief and RCT methods.
Then, I was invited to the panel interview session for around 30-45 mins. I was told to prepare the presentation I submitted from the written test, but it was not asked during the interview. Overall, I was confident with my performance but they rejected me saying that they found a better candidate.
Interview Questions: How do you explain RCT evaluation to the government?

title: Verkoop binnendienst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Heel goed veel hulp en heeft goed geholpen door de week van de omgeving in het huis van de omgeving in het huis van de omgeving in het huis van uw bestelling gaat bezorgen de van een het
Interview Questions: Ik heb het niet meer gebruik

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed but didnot receive any intimation on whether I was selected for next round or not. Even after writing to them, did not receive any reply. Very unprofessional of J-PAL.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Indicative of poor working conditions. I was offered a part-time job requiring a full -time commitment, what a joke. They seemed more concerned about showing their grant providers that they are working than about the work itself.
Interview Questions: A written test (case study with questions) followed by a one-on-one interview.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: I participated in a first round interview (not sure how many there will be). Zoom interview with 2 people, whom were both amiable and polite but seemed unsure of the process themselves- I got the impression that this was for a newly formed team, but they were both very professional and I think I will be moved to the next round.
Interview Questions: in what way would you contribute to J-PAL

title: Finance/Operations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews with various members of the team, timed written exercise, reference check. Relatively long process from when I submitted my application but received updates throughout the process.
Interview Questions: How past experience is relevant to this role

title: Policy/Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: The interview process in India was extensive. One round of panel interview with a junior member of the team and a fairly senior member. Thereafter an outgoing employee holding the position. A written test that went on for a couple of hours, and after that an interview with the Director of the unit. The thing is they were not clear about the number of interviews they will take or how long the entire process will last, and that was not conveyed. The HR seemed equally clueless. They never got back on the application rejection either, which was very disappointing given the amount of time spent on the entire process.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were fairly typical. Some were related to previous job experiences, others technical on J-PAL's work.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at J-PAL (New York, NY) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very moderate and not too intimidating . Just be honest and ask a lot of questions and they will probably hire you. Dress semi professional especially if applying for a higher position
Interview Questions: What is one quality that makes you stand out

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Mainly 3 rounds. First up is a call by current RAs asking about the background and general interest. Then after the initial screening, one or more RAs ask questions about RCTs, econometric methods, few situational questions. In most of the interviews I gave, the RAs would rarely show any sort of interest and seemed to be just doing the interviews as some sort of compulsion .
Interview Questions: Internal vs external validity, identification strategies, RCT pros and cons et al.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by case study and coding exercises. Phone interview had both technical assessment as well as personality test. There were also situational questions involved. Technical questions were about applied econometrics and development economics. Tell me about yourself question was obviously part of it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, case studies and development economics questions

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Resume drop -> economics or writing test -> short interview (~45 min.) -> final interviews (half day). Long and intensive but well-thought out and positive. Felt as if interviewers genuinely wanted me to succeed.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself.

title: Market Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions:
Three rounds, first being a technical exam.
Second round is a more focused phone interview with two members of the research team.  The questions focus on knowledge of RCTs and the ability to efficiently communicate results.  Knowledge of methods is important, as well as a working statistical vocabulary.  
Third round is a more extended conversation with the team the position works with.
Interview Questions:
How do you explain a randomized control trial to a non-expert?
What is the importance of randomization?
What is the difference between Difference-In-Differences and RCT? What kind of assumptions do they require?
Talk to us about your interest in this role.  Why J-PAL?
Scenario: meeting with the senior govt. person who is disinterested in the work; how would you convince them?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Tiruppūr) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Basic details about RCT, and behavioral questions. The interview was of average difficulty, but easy to prepare as the materials to do so are provided on the J-PAL website. The interviewer was very polite and went over the process in a cordial manner.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL (Johannesburg) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: after submitting CV and transcripts and cover letter, successful applicants are contacted and asked to write a competency test. The test asks both quantitative (programming) and qualitative questions. If you pass the test you will be contacted for a first round interview. Then, if first interview is successful you will be invited to a final interview.
Interview Questions: what experiences do you have with impact evaluations?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Luego de la postulación hubo una instancia de evaluación, que continuo con dos entrevistas, una con la directora y con quien dejaba el cargo, y la segunda con los profesores encargados del proyecto.
Interview Questions: Explicar sobre proyectos donde había trabajado anteriormente.

title: Human Resources and Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Boston, MA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quite normal. The usual tell me about yourself and why do you want to work. There was at least two from the company. Most of the questions were direct. Since I did have a management background I was  rejected.
Interview Questions: Any research experiences and conflict resolution experiences?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying, you're contacted to confirm you are available to take a test that tests your ability to synthesize research findings into a non-technical policy summary. This was followed by a phone interview.
Interview Questions: To summarize a research paper and answer questions about research design in policy terms.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at J-PAL (Cape Town) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Writing test, followed by an interview. The process required coding in R, or Stats. The idea was to simulate your decisions when faced with such a problem. The test is not a psychometric test, but rather aims to simulate similar and regular decisions you would make as the Research Associate.
The test is intended to gauge your ability to design evaluations, use data and draw conclusions for programming.
You will need Microsoft Word (or equivalent) and Stata or R to complete the test.
The exercise takes between 2 – 4 hours to complete but you will have 24 hours to complete the test, starting at a time of your choosing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at J-PAL (Jakarta) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview offer in January 2020. The interview process was good, interviewer was friendly. I was asked about myself (the usual tell me about yourself question), my experience in field research, the SWOT, and some study case about workplace
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in the field survey?

title: Policy Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a written exam on impact evaluations and later got a skype interview. The exam was 4 hours long and focused on reading regression tables and dealing with study challenges.
Interview Questions: How do you explain a randomized control trial to a non-expert?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: They ask you about your previous experiences, knowledge about J-PAL and of course about RCT Method.  They also ask you about your way to address multitasking work with multiple deliverable in parallel.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding about RCT Method?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Had a Stata Task and then a on screen interview. Stata task was timed and was not too bad. Interview was decent as well. They never got back even after emailing them about updates.
Interview Questions:
Q. technical questions related to evaluation methods
Q. behavioral question related to conflict in a group

title: Senior Manager, Policy and Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL (New Delhi) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Two members on the interview panel, one policy and one research expert. Seemed more like peers than potential supervisors for the job. Hour-long interview. Questions mostly on fit for the job, broad understanding of the role, and several scenario questions to test skill in responding to different work situations; 
Interview was by Skype.
Interview Questions:
Talk to us about interest in the role
How would you convince a senior govt person about research and policy
Scenario: meeting with senior govt. person who is disinterested in the work; how would you convince them?
Scenario: govt. person is transferred and their replacement is not interested in our line of work; how would you convince them?
Scenario: team members complain about another team  member not doing their work; how would you respond?

title: Field Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and did a Skype interview a week later. The interview lasted for about an hour and a half. The interview included technical questions and behavioral questions.  Two people interviewed me and they were very nice.
Interview Questions: What policy recommendations would you give to a decision maker in education?

title: Research Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: 2 Skype interviews, with a mix of behavioral and technical-styled questions. The first interview covered a more technical, scientific understanding of RCT's and the second interview consisted of behavioral-based questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about RCTs?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. They took very long to respond. I was invited for a telephonic interview two months after I applied, and then it took a another two weeks for them to get back to me for a second interview, and then two more weeks for a final interview -- all over the phone. Questions were asked on RCTs, surveying etc. The interviewers were all friendly, helpful and wanted me to get the answer right. Much of it was like a conversation. I was told that I'd have to work for 6 days in a week, 9 hours (or longer) a day -- which I found ironical for an organization that conducts experiments on poverty and behavioural economics; they ought to have known just how much this affects employee performance and productivity.
Interview Questions: "Explain some of the research projects you've done at college."

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: First I filled an online application that included my resume, cover letter and transcripts. They got back to me one month later and informed me I moved forward to the next stage. In this stage, they gave me 3 hours to answer a written test that included basic evaluation and statistical concepts. After 2 weeks they told me I moved forward to a phone interview where they asked me about hypothetical scenarios as well as my previous working experience.
Interview Questions: How would you explain an RCT? What would you ask someone that wants to partner to evaluate a program? Can you talk about any social policy that you know? What are the things you are good at and things that require more effort from you?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Chennai) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied to a research internship process on their website, after two telephonic interviews, I was invited to a video interview with the team in the city I applied for. I got selected after this.
Interview Questions: What do you understand by RCTs?

title: Senior Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: The first stage of the process involved a 3-hour long assessment test. The test was comprehensive, testing both policy analysis and media communications skills, but the 3 hours didn't seem sufficient.
Interview Questions: Asked to frame an email pitching an issue area for a prospective publication.

title: Policy Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL (Cape Town) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had to take a statistics test sent via email (to be returned within a fixed time) and then had a final round interview with leadership of the office virtually. Really thoughtful staff and quite a useful interview process.
Interview Questions: How would you design a randomized evaluation of a particular process?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: There was no initial HR interview and so the first interview I went into was an hour long with a combination of behavioral and technical questions. Behavioral questions included dealing with research associates who may not like doing the work. Technical questions included more general questions about designing and implementing a research study.
Interview Questions: How would you design a study to investigate the impact of a program? Which communities would you focus on?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Cambridge, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I took a software exam and writing test. During the software exam I had to demonstrate familiarity with statistical software and during the writing I had to demonstrate familiarity with statistics, economics, and econometrics
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was first a 30 mins phone call interview. The i was scheduled for a 2 hour skill test done remotely. The questions and literature was sent to me at an agreed time and i had to answer and reply after 2 hours
Interview Questions: White a Policy brief, interpret  some quantitative data

title: Policy and Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two-fold interview process. First is a writing exam that tests your ability to analyze research and transform it for a policy audience. Second is an oral interview that focuses on your interest in the field, what you know about randomized control trials, and what your interests are in the position.
Interview Questions: What is the importance of randomization?

title: North America Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It's an intense process for an undergraduate internship. I was one of 400 to apply online in December, one of 13 to receive a 3+ hour writing/research test in January, and one of 4 to be interviewed by Skype in February. The interview was with two employees, and it was both behavioral and skills-based, with some case questions.
Interview Questions: What is a recent publication of our that caught your attention? What did you learn?

title: Policy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 3 weeks. They first short-list you to decide whether you take a writing test or not. The test is fairly simple if you have an understanding of research and statistics. There was then a 45 minute Skype interview. They were very communicative and the hiring process was very streamlined.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a conflict at work?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at J-PAL (Jakarta) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very formal and time consuming, but the test was awesome and insightful. There are 3 steps of interview, the interview with managers, Principal Investigators, then with HR for salary negotiation.
Interview Questions: Do you familiar with experimental study and its method?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 11 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Kabul) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The manager shook my hand and took me in the office. He gave me a tour, then we went back to the office and asked me questions such as what experience do you have relevant to this role
Interview Questions:
How tall are you?
How much do you weigh?

title: Communication Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: First round was written part that consists of making policy brief, translation, event invitation, social media buzz, target audience research. Then in-person interview about experience in research and research communication, policy publication. The interview is quite straightforward, around 1 hour, and the interviewer was very friendly and made me feel at ease.
Interview Questions: How would you manage our social media account so more people are attuned to study results published by JPAL?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Apply online around December for the common pool as well as specific projects. Multiple PIs contact you according to your experience and interest. The interviews generally involve stata test, detailed question about RCT and involved econometric, conversation with Research Manager or other RA.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between DID and RCT? What kind of assumptions do thy require? What is the difference between ITT and ATE?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was average, although they took long to respond after completing the policy test. I did not make it to the second round although i believe i did my best.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in policy work?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at J-PAL (Chennai) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Generally simple interview process. Began with 2 minute description of my resume, followed by questions on my basic knowledge of field research and data collection. This was followed by creative questions ie "have you ever handled a problem In a creative manner?" And questions on how I would handle certain scenarios. Interview concluded with any questions I had for the interviewers.
Interview Questions: What is a kernel? What is an enumeration?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Apply through the J-PAL common application. You can get interview calls for multiple positions and you have to go through the interview process for each one separately. You can get multiple offers and chose which one you want to take up.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with Stata?

title: Policy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL (New Delhi) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interview were conducted. The first round of interview tests the understanding on RCTs. The second round was a personal interview in which all the other details were covered
Interview Questions:
knowledge about RCTs
previous work experience
why J-PAL
questions on hobbies

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at J-PAL (New York, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call, did well, but they didn't hire me.  I'm really not sure why.  I think it was because I didn't know a lot of the answers to the questions that they asked me
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: STATA test followed by 3-4 rounds of interview where you have to convince the PIs and the managers that you will be a good decision maker and have experienc ein project management + data analysis
Interview Questions: How would you ensure that surveyors are actually completing the survey?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at J-PAL (New Delhi) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
J-PAL follows a three month hiring cycle. 
Submission of resume and case study followed by telephonic interviews by other research managers in Delhi.
followed by interview with Principal Investigator of the study
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with stata?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at J-PAL in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview usually comes after having successfully passed their test. During the test and the interview they are trying to assess your qualifications as someone with quantitative knowledge and someone who knows RCTs. Additionally, they want to see if you are able to manage people, projects on tight deadlines and work with the most vulnerable population.
Interview Questions: How would you assess the success of a labor training program on labor market outcomes?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at J-PAL (Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: STATA test - got three days to attempt it and was pretty simple if you have used STATA.

Step 2: Interview with another RA - 

Step 3: Spoke to RM 

Step 4: Interview with PI
Interview Questions: What an RCT is, what is the difference between random assignment and random sample, what is omitted variable bias.Was asked to describe data analysis experience, project management experience etc Was asked what experience I had in education, made to talk about all work experience.

title: Policy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application online which included a resume and cover letter. Was invited to interview over the phone (I assume this would have been in person if I had lived in the area). Two interviewers on the call, asking a mix of personal and professional questions. In advance of the call they asked me to complete a short organizational task, but this wasn't discussed in the interview. Received an offer soon afterwards.
Interview Questions: What have you learned so far in your econometrics class?

title: Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at J-PAL
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application in general pool, invited to do take home test, invited to phone interview after review of take home test. I thought the phone interview would be technical questions about the take home test, but it was more behavioral than technical. Lesson learned -- be prepared for behavioral questions at any interview! The manner of the phone interviewers was more business-like than warm, but they probably had a ton to do that day.
Interview Questions: Asked me to explain a specific evaluation design.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at J-PAL in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had one skype interview where they asked the basic competency questions. Lasted for an hour. Questions were very easy. Interviewer was very friendly. Although I never got a reply on my status.
Interview Questions: What research skills do you have?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the application through the common application.  I was contacted by JPAL south asia and had to a test. The test included a case study and answering questions related to the case study. It was all about outputs, outcomes and impact. It also included a Stata test where they provided a dataset and had me run a few commands. The interview that followed the test was very technical and all about RCTs and how to conduct them and data collection. I was then contacted by the researchers for an interview with a specific project. The interview again included a lot of questions pertaining to RCTs and data collection. Prepare technical questions pertaining to experimental and quasi-experimental designs and behavioral questions about living in a developing country.
Interview Questions: They asked very detailed questions about RCTs. For someone who had one semester worth of course on experimental design, they were a little confusing. But they walked you through the questions and helped you figure out the answer.

title: Field Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at J-PAL (Patna, Bihar) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: First check qualification certificate and take simple written test. If pass the written test then they take oral interview by their panel ( Mostly three person) after the interview they also brief about their organization and their work
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Policy Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied through their online system and was contacted to complete a written test within 1 week. A week or so later I was contacted for a phone interview. The interviewers were cordial but asked fairly tough questions, including some technical questions about different types of impact evaluations. I didn't get a response for several months.
Interview Questions: Why would you use a regression discontinuity evaluation in this context?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at J-PAL (Jeddah) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: in interview many things should be checked like whether a worker can motivate and deal with a worker or not and whether a worker do have a knowledge about the field he/she applying for ...
Interview Questions: how much e experience do u have ?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at J-PAL in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was rather quick.  After filling out the application online, I received multiple emails from different Principal Investigators (PIs) for different projects.  The email consisted of details about the project, and  a potential timeline for the phone interview.  Once I scheduled the phone interview, I spoke with the PI for approx. 50 minutes.  The interview entailed familiarity with STATA/comfort with performing econometrics/long term plans etc.  Very standard!
Interview Questions: Honestly, no unexpected question.  The interview was pretty straight forward.
